abstracts.cdata!:
Overall, the project development
            objectives were successfully achieved. Highly satisfactory
            was the Bank's performance, who gained efficiency
            combining the preparation stage with that of two other
            projects on the subjects of environmental technology, and
            science/technical education, thus resulting in a clear
            understanding of sector-related policy issues. The overall
            borrower performance was satisfactory, with an impressive
            performance by project institutions, erasing an early
            "unsatisfactory" rating, related to a delayed
            legal covenant compliance. It is therefore interesting to
            note, as a lesson to be learned, that good working
            relationships, stemming from frequent and detailed
            supervision, combined with an efficient coordination by the
            Ministry of Education, can lead not only to a successful
            operation, but save a project, turning it around from an
            unsatisfactory assessment.
